question.text: A stream of a positively charged particles having <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfrac><mi mathvariant="italic">q</mi><mi mathvariant="italic">m</mi></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>11</mn></msup><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi>kg</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> and velocity <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mover><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>7</mn></msup><mo> </mo><mover><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> is deflected by an electric field <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>1</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>8</mn><mover><mi>j</mi><mo mathvariant="italic">^</mo></mover><mo> </mo><mi>kV</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>. The electric field exists in a region of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>10</mn><mo> </mo><mi>cm</mi></math> along <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi></math> direction. Due to the electric field, the deflection of the charge particles in the <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>y</mi></math> direction is _____  <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>mm</mi></math>.

solution.text:
Acceleration of the particles due to electric field, a=Fm=qEm=2×10111.8×103

=3.6×1014 m s-2

Time to cross plates =dv

⇒t=0.103×107

Now deflection,

y=12at2=123.6×10140.103×1072

=0.002 m

=2 mm
